intro: Agrostis pringlei, commonly known as the Pringle's bentgrass, is a species of grass native to the western United States. It is characterized by its fine, tufted growth habit and narrow, grass-like leaves. This plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils in meadows and along stream banks. Agrostis pringlei is often found in high-altitude environments, such as mountainous regions. Its botanical features make it an important component of local ecosystems and a subject of interest in botanical studies.
